isis.stitle: AIR COMPRESSOR: BENDIX 2150 - DISASSEMBLY - CYLINDER HEAD

svcproc.title: CYLINDER HEAD
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 11for all numbers in parentheses.
Remove the four cylinder head cap screws (12) and tap the head with a soft mallet to break the gasket seal. Scrape off any gasket material from the cylinder head and crankcase.
Before disassembling the discharge valve mechanism, measure and record the discharge valve travel (from closed to completely open).

step1.para: lf the measured discharge valve travel does not exceed .032 inches, the discharge valve stop need not be removed. lt is recommended that the cylinder head body be replaced if the discharge valve stop requires replacement. In the event this is not possible the following procedure can be followed.

To remove the discharge valve stop (15), support the machined surface of the cylinder head on an arbor press bed and gently press the stop from the top of the head and out the bottom. Be sure to allow sufficient clearance for the stop between the press bed and the bottom of the cylinder head. The valve stop bore in the cylinder head must be inspected for excessive scoring. A new cylinder head body must be used if scoring is excessive.
Using a 9/16" Allen wrench, remove the discharge valve seat, valve, and valve spring (18, 17, 16).
Insert the lugs of a spanner wrench into the holes of the inlet valve stop (10) and remove the inlet valve stop along with the inlet valve (8), valve seat (7), unloader gasket (6) and spring (5).

Inspect the unloader piston bushing (2) for nicks, wear, corrosion and scoring. lt is recommended that the cylinder head body be replaced.if it is determined that the unloader piston bushing requires replacement. lf this is not possible, the bushing can be pressed out of the head using the same procedure presented in Step 2 of this disassembly section.

note.para: lf the bushing is pressed out and the cylinder head casting is damaged in the process, cylinder head repair is not recommended. Pressing in the replacement bushing will result in air or water leakage.
